intro: Phalacroloma strigosum, commonly known as the hairy phalacroloma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
